2162.subject: HOSP
2162.descrlong:
Builds connections  between  protected  areas and  eco-tourists.  Fosters  personal relevance of and appreciation  for a natural area leading to behavioral changes among visitors to ecotourism areas and  attractions.  Examines  philosophies,  methods,  ethics,  research,  and  controversies involved   with   modern   interpretation  practices  in  the  context   of  ecotourism.   Students synthesize  course  topics  into  hands-on   experiential  learning.  (Sections  may  be  offered  as classroom-based,  hybrid or online courses.)

[Prereq: ENVS 201 and (BUS 305 or ENVS 284 or SBS 351)]
